name: Google I/O Extended Nairobi
description: As the first Google I/O Extended collaboration by GDG Strathmore, GDG USIU, GDG JKUAT and GDG Nairobi we’re super excited to bring together an audience of enthusiasts, developers and creators on the biggest tech event of the year. Our event will contain codelabs, speaker sessions from Google Developer Experts, and a livestream of the keynote speeches. We believe that this event will act as a way for the tech community in Strathmore University to come together to discuss the progress of technology, learn new things and all in all have a piece of the action at I/O in their local community.
how_to_find_us: Big, bold, bright signs will deck the entrance of the Strathmore University Auditorium, Ole Sangale Road, Madaraka, Nairobi, Kenya.

name: DevFest Nairobi 2017
description:
GDG DevFest 2017 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Joining thousands all over the world for the greatest series of DevFest events DevFest Nairobi and Central Google Developer Groups are coming together to have the biggest developer event of the year! aimed at familiarizing attendees (who are members of a variety of developer communities) with groundbreaking technology advancements. We will be working closely with Women Techmakers in this devfest season, to continue improving the diversity in our ecosystem. Â
how_to_find_us: Find us on maps or reach out to us on meetup or on Facebook at GDG Nairobi.

name: Cloud Study Jam
description:
• What we'll do
Learn the fundamentals of the Google Cloud Platform, how to run containers on it and how to use the platform for data engineering. Attendees get free access to the labs ($70+ value). No need to create a Google Cloud Platform account or register with a credit card.

One in-person session of 3 hours, followed by 2-8 hours of self-study.

• What to bring
Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.

Laptop charger.

The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.

• Important to know
At the event we’ll use a tool called “Qwiklabs,” a Google training product. If you have used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you have never used Qwiklabs before, save time by creating an account for yourself prior to the class at: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up (creating an account is free). At the event we will give you a link that gives you one month of free Qwiklabs access.
how_to_find_us: Session will be at Kifaru Room, 4th Floor Student's Centre

name: I/O Extended 2018 Strathmore
description:
Google I/O (simply I/O) is an annual developer conference held by Google in Mountain View, California. I/O showcases technical in-depth sessions focused on building web, mobile, and enterprise applications with Google and open sources such as Android, Chrome and Chrome OS, APIs, Google Web Toolkit, App Engine, and more. The conference brings together developers from around the globe for talks, hands-on learning with Google experts, and a first look at Google’s latest developer products.

I/O Extended events are held around the world for developers to take part in the I/O experience.

name: Introducing DSC Strathmore University
description: Join us today for the inaugural DSC Strathmore University meetup. Here we will introduce the club to the student developer community and get to learn more about the essence of the new Developer Student Clubs!

name: Marsh Middleton: Introducing Flamelink.io, a realtime, headless CMS for Firebase
description:
Firebase is a powerful tool in any developer’s arsenal. It’s loved by developers all around the world because it’s speedy, secure and scalable. It’s got everything but the kitchen sink. Well, that and an easy-to-use interface to make managing content for non-technical clients and content managers really easy.

Introducing Flamelink.io, a realtime, headless CMS built specifically for Firebase. In this talk, we’ll talk about how Firebase and Flamelink has helped our team solve the specific issue of adding content in a way that saves developers precious time, and content managers’ sanity.

Speaker: Marsh Middleton

Marsh is one of the co-founders of Flamelink.io and has over 20 years of experience in the tech, content and e-commerce industries. A Firebase evangelist through-and-through, Marsh hopes that Firebase and Flamelink can offer an en-to-end, user-friendly experience, whether you’re a developer, a content manager or the user of an amazing App built on Firebase.
how_to_find_us: Kifaru Room, iLab Africa, 4th Floor Student's Center, Strathmore University

name: Flutter Study Jam
description: Join us for the our first Study Jam! Flutter UI is a modern hybrid framework that makes cross platform development. We are gonna go through the basics and build something awesome!
